an4.233:4.1: “Mendicants, I declare these four kinds of deeds, having realized them with my own insight.
an4.233:4.3: 1. There are dark deeds with dark results;
an4.233:4.5: • dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results; and
an4.233:4.6: • neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the end of deeds.
an4.233:5.1: And what are dark deeds with dark results?
an4.233:5.2: It’s when someone makes hurtful choices by way of body, speech, and mind.
an4.233:5.3: Having made these choices, they’re reborn in a hurtful world,
an4.233:5.5: Touched by hurtful contacts, they experience hurtful feelings that are exclusively painful—like the beings in hell.
an4.233:5.6: These are called dark deeds with dark results.
an4.233:6.1: And what are bright deeds with bright results?
an4.233:6.2: It’s when someone makes pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind.
an4.233:6.3: Having made these choices, they’re reborn in a pleasing world,
an4.233:6.5: Touched by pleasing contacts, they experience pleasing feelings that are exclusively happy—like the gods replete with glory.
an4.233:6.6: These are called bright deeds with bright results.
an4.233:7.1: And what are dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results?
an4.233:7.2: It’s when someone makes both hurtful and pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind.
an4.233:7.3: Having made these choices, they are reborn in a world that is both hurtful and pleasing,
an4.233:7.4: where hurtful and pleasing contacts touch them.
an4.233:7.5: Touched by both hurtful and pleasing contacts, they experience both hurtful and pleasing feelings that are a mixture of pleasure and pain—like humans, some gods, and some beings in the underworld.
an4.233:7.6: These are called dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results.
an4.233:8.1: And what are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the end of deeds?
an4.233:8.2: It’s the intention to give up dark deeds with dark results, bright deeds with bright results, and both dark and bright deeds with both dark and bright results.
an4.233:8.3: These are called neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the end of deeds.
an4.233:8.4: These are the four kinds of deeds that I declare, having realized them with my own insight.”
